# SRAbsoluteTime

**Structure**

A value that describes when the system records the data.

## Declaration

```swift
struct SRAbsoluteTime
```

## Discussion

This value tracks monotonically increasing device-specific time, unlike [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/kernel/1646199-mach_continuous_time], which keeps tracking across reboots.

Although a fetch can query a [doc://com.apple.sensorkit/documentation/SensorKit/SRFetchRequest/device] other than a phone (such as a paired watch), the framework consistently describes time according to the phone. Any fetch results from a paired watch are in the phone’s version of [doc://com.apple.sensorkit/documentation/SensorKit/SRAbsoluteTime].

## Creating an Absolute Time

- **init(_:)**: Creates an absolute time from a raw value.
- **init(rawValue:)**: Creates an absolute time from a raw value.

## Accessing the Current Absolute Time

- **current()**: Provides the current absolute time.

## Converting Absolute Times

- **toCFAbsoluteTime()**: Converts an absolute time to a core-foundation absolute time.

## Defining the Time Range

- **from**: Fetches sample information that occurs after this time.
- **to**: Fetches sample information that occurs before this time.
- **current()**: Provides the current absolute time.
- **toCFAbsoluteTime()**: Converts an absolute time to a core-foundation absolute time.
